title: Management Trainee
job_desc:
Exypnox Inc. is mission-driven, fast-growing Business Process Outsourcing company focused on defining and developing the next generation of talent to work with some of the best software companies globally. 

We are looking for a driven and detail-oriented recent graduate to join our Management Trainee program and develop into a future leader.

Job Description: As a Management Trainee focusing on Business Development, you will be instrumental in driving the organization's growth and efficiency through strategic involvement in finance and operations. Your role will encompass analyzing data, developing impactful campaigns, and streamlining processes to achieve business objectives. Thus providing an excellent opportunity to develop a broad skill set, and become a driving force in making a significant impact on the growth and success of our organization.

The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, proactive problem-solving abilities, a creative mindset to contribute to the company‚Äôs business development initiatives, and a likeable personality that fits our company‚Äôs culture.
 

Key Responsibilities:

Finance

  • Assist in analyzing financial reports, forecasts, and budgets to support strategic planning.
  • Collaborate with the finance team to evaluate business opportunities and assess financial feasibility.
  • Monitor and report on key financial metrics, identifying trends and actionable insights.
  • Support pricing strategies, cost analysis, and revenue optimization initiatives.

Operations

  • Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, industry standards, and client-specific protocols.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize operational workflows in order to improve business efficiency and scalability.
  • Participate in cross-functional projects to support process improvements, and client activities.
  • Collaborate with internal teams, including Operations, Human Resources, Recruitment, and IT, to facilitate seamless operations, address operational challenges, and refine business strategies.

 

Hybrid Set-up: This is a hybrid work-set up from Monday to Friday , with 3 days onsite and 2 days work-from-home.

 

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary with allowances (food and cellular)
  • Hybrid work set-up with a brand new laptop
  • HMO with dental benefits after 6 months
  • Guaranteed Work-Life Balance
  • Top-notch Learning, Culture, and Development Programs
  • Guaranteed Stability and Job Security
  • Paid Leaves: Holiday, Medical, and Vacation
  • Regular Social Activities and company sponsored meals
  • 13th Month Bonus

 

Must have:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Business Administration, Management Studies, Business Analytics, Marketing, Communication, Entrepreneurship, or any related field.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with proficiency in data analysis 
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with a talent for building rapport.
  • Analytical mindset and ability to use data to support decision-making.
  • Creativity, attention to detail, and the ability to meet multiple deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Proficiency in graphic design tools (e.g., Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva, etc)
  • Knowledge of digital marketing and social media platforms.

     

Preferred Skills and Experiences:

  • Internship or prior experience in business development, marketing, finance, or operations is a plus.
  • Creative thinking and a passion for driving business growth.
  • Familiarity with market research tools and techniques.
  • Self-motivated with a proactive approach to identifying opportunities and solving problems.

title: Human Resources Intern
job_desc:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Human Resources Student Intern will support the HR department in various functions, including recruitment, employee relations, training and development, and administrative tasks for Manila Business Services. This internship provides an excellent opportunity for students to gain hands-on experience in HR practices and contribute to the company's overall success.

 

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Support for recruitment process, screening resumes, and scheduling interviews.
  • Support onboarding and orientation programs for new employees.
  • Participate in employee engagement initiatives and events.
  • Assist in organizing training sessions and development programs.
  • Provide administrative support to the HR team, including filing, data entry, CV formatting and document preparation.
  • Conduct research on HR best practices and contribute to policy development.
  • Respond to employee inquiries and provide assistance as needed.
  • Other duties as assigned. 

 

QUALIFICATIONS (KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES)

  • Currently enrolled in a bachelor‚Äôs degree program in Human Resources, Business Administration, Psychology, or related field.
  • Strong interest in pursuing a career in Human Resources
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Detail- Oriented with Strong organizational and time management abilities.
  • Basic knowledge in Microsoft Office Suite
  • Enthusiastic team player with a positive attitude and eagerness to learn.
  • Ability to handle and maintain confidential information. 

 

OTHERS

  • Willingness to work in a hybrid work environment (At least 2 days in the Pasig City office).
  • Reporting to: Organizational Development Manager
     

By proceeding you are agreeing that you have read and accept the privacy policy https://www.allegisgroup.com/en-au/privacy-notice/philippines

 

OUR BUSINESS

Allegis Group is the global leader in talent solutions, focused on working harder and caring more than any other provider. We go further to understand the needs of our people ‚Äì our clients, our candidates, and our employees ‚Äì and to consistently deliver on our promise of an unsurpassed quality experience. That is the Allegis Group difference, and it is consistent across every Allegis Group brand.

With more than US$15.8 billion in annual revenues and over 500+ locations across the globe, our network provides businesses with a comprehensive suite of talent solutions ‚Äî without sacrificing the niche expertise required to ensure a successful partnership. Our specialized group of companies includes: Actalent, Aerotek, Allegis Global Solutions, Aston Carter, Career Circle, Getting Hired, MarketSource, QuantumWork, TEKsystems and Major, Lindsey & Africa.

Allegis Group APAC has over 1,200 employees across the region operating from offices in Australia and New Zealand (ANZ), Hong Kong, Japan, Singapore (HPP), China, India, Malaysia, Philippines, and Thailand. We have ambitious targets, so we have a well-defined business strategy in place to ensure we are in the best possible position to achieve these targets, drive growth across our chosen markets and be successful.

WORKING WITH US

True to our commitment, your opportunity starts here!  Our purpose is to create significant opportunity for people to achieve their goals through career success and fulfilment. The foundation of our collective success is rooted in our unwavering commitment to four shared core values ‚Äì character, competitive spirit, relationships and serving others. The Manila Business Services (MBS) team is part of our Allegis Group Corporate Services that supports different operating companies across APAC; thus, you will get to grow and learn with our diversified workforce around the Asia Pacific. We follow a hybrid remote, and in-office set up, follow Philippines Holidays, and primarily work on a day shift schedule unless required to work on other shifts due to businesses supported and projects.

Join us and be part of our aspiration to become the Regional Business Services Centre and Employer of Choice by delivering world class client, stakeholder, and employee experience, insights, and results.

title: Shift Manager - Open to Fresh Graduates (Makati, Taguig, Mandaluyong, Pasig)
job_desc:
We are seeking motivated and ambitious individuals to join our team as Shift Managers. If you possess a passion for the food industry, leadership, and delivering exceptional customer service, this role could be an ideal opportunity for you, including recent graduates looking to launch their careers.

As a Shift Manager, you will have the opportunity to develop your leadership skills and gain valuable experience in the Quick Service Restaurant (QSR) industry. This position also provides a unique chance to establish a strong professional network within the industry, contributing to both personal and professional growth.

You‚Äôll play a key role in ensuring smooth restaurant operations by:
- Overseeing restaurant staff and schedules
- Managing opening and closing procedures
- Leading kitchen staff to maintain high-quality food and service standards
- Ensuring proper shift handovers for seamless operations
- Handling store funds and implementing cash control procedures
- Finding ways to reduce expenses and stay within budget

We love teamwork and great energy! That‚Äôs why we need someone who can maintain positive employee relations, promote teamwork, and serve as a role model for our Restaurant Partners. You‚Äôll coach and guide the team to uphold our service and product quality standards.

Customer satisfaction is at the heart of what we do! You'll be responsible for:

  • Managing customer concerns and ensuring service recovery
  • Building and maintaining great relationships with customers and the team
  • Making sure every guest leaves with a smile

Who Can Apply?
- Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Hotel & Restaurant Management, Food & Beverage Services, Hospitality, Operations Management, or any related field.
- Fresh graduates are welcome to apply! Prior experience in a leadership role or internship in a quick-service restaurant is a plus but not required.
- Strong leadership, organization, and customer service skills.
- Ability to manage time, inventory, and staff effectively.

Join our Poppin‚Äô team and start an exciting career with Popeyes!

title: Environmental and Social (E&S) Data Operations Intern
job_desc:
Your Team Responsibilities

The Environmental and Social (E&S) team provides high-quality data to internal stakeholders and ensures that outputs are aligned with the methodology. Through the use of available resources in automation and integrating human-in-the-loop in the processes, the team also aims to achieve their target percentage on precision and recalls ensuring high-quality environment and social data and timely delivery.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Address data issues in the given task by following the predefined scope and objectives and examining all relevant areas

  • Support in writing output prompts for new datapoints by exploring OpenAI and Microsoft Co-Pilot in building and writing sample prompts for the E&S team to use and test in the project

  • Ensure the accurate data extraction adhering to the new E&S methodology, where the interns will be helping the E&S team in validating the data extraction done by checking the data and its alignment with the new E&S methodology

  • Identify source of error and provide detailed investigation/remarks for each issue or incorrect extraction by giving the correct data that should have been extracted from the issuer reports used

  • Communicate results and create detailed progress reports to support the E&S team's data validation analysis by having a weekly update in the weekly scrums/ placeholders set by the E&S team

  • Ensure the timely completion of validation tasks: the validation files, which will be reviewed by interns, will be sporadically shared with a tight deadline and strict ETAs should be met

Your Skills and Experience That Will Help You Excel

  • Undergraduate students taking Finance/Economics or Business Management, International Development & Relations, Social Science, Interdisciplinary Studies, Sustainability, or related degrees

  • Sound knowledge about ESG and responsible investment in general and knowledge on the company disclosures, filings, public company reporting including 10-Ks, annual reports, and CSR

  • Knowledge on prompt writing and OpenAI/ Co-pilot

  • Keen to details and independent worker as well as good team player with a strong sense of ownership

  • Proficient in Excel/Word; Excellent comprehension and analytical skills

  • Can join the Internship program from June to August 2025

title: Instrument Data Management - Intern
job_desc:
Your Team Responsibilities

The Manila Time Series team is part of the Instrument Data Management function under the wider Data Content Services group. The team performs quality assurance and maintains data integrity for both exchange-traded and over-the-counter instruments delivered by external vendors which are then utilized by MSCI Analytics products and risk platforms.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with Project Lead: Work closely with the Project Lead to gain an understanding of the current data infrastructure, processes, and business requirements related to data quality assurance.

  • Process Mapping: Develop detailed process maps to identify potential areas for automation, focusing on improving efficiency, reducing errors, and accelerating workflows within the data validation processes.

  • Automation Opportunities: Identify and recommend at least 2-3 key areas where automation can be applied to streamline operations, increase speed, and improve overall process accuracy.

  • Design Decision Trees: Design and implement scalable decision trees for automated data validation, ensuring consistency and accuracy across various data validation tasks and processes.

  • Python Script Development: Create and optimize Python test scripts for validating large datasets, ensuring data accuracy and integrity, and reducing manual validation time by 70%-80%.

  • Test Script Optimization: Continuously improve and optimize test scripts to enhance performance, reliability, and scalability while ensuring these can efficiently handle large datasets.

  • Data Validation: Perform automated validation to ensure that data meets predefined criteria, achieving at least 95% accuracy.

  • Operational Efficiency: Contribute to driving operational efficiency by reducing manual intervention, automating critical QA processes, and improving the overall speed and accuracy of data validation workflows.

  • Reporting and Documentation: Provide regular updates on progress, document key findings, and present actionable insights to the Project Lead.

Your Skills and Experience That Will Help You Excel

  • Course: Computer Science, Statistics and/or any related Quantitative Programs

  • Skills: Proficiency in SQL and Python is a must. Experience in handling big data and has a good understanding of data infrastructures.

  • Can join the Internship program from June to August 2025

title: OPERATIONS - IT INTERN (CAN START ASAP)

title: Campus Recruiter

At Hudson RPO we embrace curiosity, think differently, and shape the future of Talent

A little bit about us:

From recruitment process outsourcing (RPO) to employer branding and across the complete talent life-cycle, we thrive in delivering world-class customer and candidate experiences. People are at the center of everything we do. We deliver innovative, customized recruitment services and talent solutions to organizations worldwide.

We‚Äôre an innovative and diverse team that works hard and thinks smart. Led by accomplished and inclusive leaders, our people are always open to trying new things to continuously bring excellence into our client solutions. At Hudson RPO we don‚Äôt just accept difference ‚Äì we celebrate it, support it, and thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our clients, and our community. title: Operations Associate
job_desc:
Apply directly: https://point.com/hiring?gh_jid=7876824002

 

Location: Four NEO, 4th Ave, Taguig, Metro Manila, Philippines

Job Type: Full-time

Job Shift: Night 

 

Who we are

At Point, we make homeownership more valuable and accessible. Join us in creating innovative financial products that help homeowners and aspiring buyers. If you're seeking a career where your work truly matters, this is it.

 

Job Summary

Join Point‚Äôs inaugural Operations Associate program and embark on a journey that will redefine your career trajectory. As a member of a select cohort of 10-15 recent graduates, you‚Äôll dive into the US residential real estate market and gain practical experience in five critical operational roles: underwriting, valuations underwriting, processing, closing, and funding. This rotational program is built to develop your professional skill set, foster innovation, and prepare you for a fast-paced career in a cutting-edge fintech environment. After gaining exposure to every role you'll have the opportunity to focus on the one that best aligns with your strengths, passions, and business needs. For those who excel, exceptional opportunities for quick advancement into leadership positions await.

 

Location Options

Point offers both in-office and work-from-home options. Our office is at Four/NEO, BGC. Work-from-home is available for experienced candidates with suitable remote work setup and subject to maintaining high-performance standards.

 

Qualifications and skills

  • A strong desire to deliver exceptional customer service and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
  • Genuine enthusiasm for fintech, real estate, and the dynamic environment of a high-growth tech company.
  • Previous internships or relevant work experience are a plus

 

Our benefits

  • Career Advancement: Benefit from structured development programs, promotions, and certifications.
  • Work-Life Balance: 18 holidays, and hybrid work options in a supportive environment.

Point is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer.

title: Desktop Intern
job_func: Help Desk & IT Support (Information & Communication Technology)
job_desc:
Desktop Support Intern ‚Äì Job Description

Overview

The Desktop Support Intern will assist the IT team in providing technical support to end-users, troubleshooting hardware and software issues, and maintaining IT assets. This internship offers hands-on experience in desktop support, system maintenance, and IT service management, making it an excellent opportunity for students or recent graduates to gain real-world IT skills.

Responsibilities and Duties

Technical Support & Troubleshooting

  • Assist with troubleshooting and resolving basic hardware, software, and network connectivity issues.

  • Support end-users with software installations, system configurations, and peripheral setup.

  • Provide first-level assistance for desktop and laptop-related issues under IT supervision.

System Maintenance & Security

  • Help perform routine system maintenance, updates, and security patching.

Installation & Configuration

  • Support IT staff in setting up new desktops, laptops, and peripherals.

  • Assist in installing and configuring operating systems and business applications.

User Assistance & Training

  • Provide guidance to employees on IT best practices and basic troubleshooting steps.

Documentation & Asset Management

  • Maintain records of IT support requests, troubleshooting steps, and resolutions.

  • Assist in tracking and managing IT assets, including inventory updates and device assignments.

Proactive Monitoring & Issue Prevention

  • Monitor system performance for potential issues and report findings to the IT team.

  • Assist in implementing preventative measures to reduce recurring IT incidents.

Technical Skills & Qualifications

  • Currently pursuing or recently completed an Associate‚Äôs or Bachelor‚Äôs degree in IT, Computer Science, or a related field.

  • Basic knowledge of Windows, macOS, Microsoft 365, and networking fundamentals.

  • Familiarity with IT troubleshooting techniques, strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills.

Work Arrangement

  • Location: Mandaluyong (or company-specific location).

  • Schedule: Part-time or full-time internship (based on availability and business needs).

  • Onsite Role: May require occasional hands-on work with IT hardware and equipment.

  • With PHP 100 per day allowance for interns

We are seeking a motivated and enthusiastic Sales Coordinator Intern to join our team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to gain hands-on experience and develop essential sales skills within our dynamic and fast-paced organization. This internship is designed to provide you with exposure to various aspects of the sales process, allowing you to contribute to our team's success while learning from experienced professionals. This is an excellent opportunity to kick-start your career in sales and make a meaningful impact.

 

On top of your salary, here are the exciting benefits you can look forward to:

  • You‚Äôll be interacting with key players such as C-level executives from enterprise-level organizations which can expand your skills and network.
  • Making sound decision-making and flexibility to ensure team dynamics and productivity.

The main responsibilities of a SALES INTERN include:

‚Ä¢    Client Visit/Engagement Coordination: Assist in customer engagement activities, arrange and book transportation for client visits, coordinate schedules and logistics with the Customer Experience (CX) team, Client Services Manager (CSM), Marketing, and other departments, provide sales support as needed, and arrange restaurant or catering bookings as required.
‚Ä¢    Team Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, customer success, and product development, to ensure a seamless customer experience and drive sales growth.

To apply, you must be an expert on the following requirements:

Minimum Qualifications:

‚Ä¢    Passion for Sales: Demonstrated interest in sales and a strong desire to pursue a career in the field.
‚Ä¢    Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to engage and build relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
‚Ä¢    Problem-Solving Abilities: A proactive approach to problem-solving and attention to detail
‚Ä¢    Technological Proficiency: Comfortable working with technology and Microsoft Office Suite
‚Ä¢    Time Management: Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
‚Ä¢    Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively within a team, as well as independently, while maintaining a positive and professional attitude.
‚Ä¢    Results-Oriented: Demonstrated ability to set goals, take ownership of tasks, and deliver results with a focus on exceeding targets.

 

It will also be favorable if you are knowledgeable in:

Nice to have:
‚Ä¢    Adaptability: Willingness to learn and adapt to new sales strategies, tools, and market dynamics.
‚Ä¢    Technological Proficiency: Basic understanding of CRM systems, Microsoft Office Suite, and other sales-related software (Enterprise Resource Planning, HubSpot etc.)

title: HR Admin | Day Shift | Onsite | BGC | Weekends Off | Day 1 HMO | Up to PHP30K
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila
job_desc:
Empowering Your Career in Healthcare Training Support

Our client, InHealth Group, is a leading healthcare provider renowned for their innovative approach to patient care and employee development. With operations spanning multiple countries, they offer employees a chance to collaborate on impactful projects that shape the future of healthcare. They are committed to excellence, compliance, and fostering a culture of growth and collaboration.

Job Description

As an HR Admin, you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in organizing and maintaining training courses for new local and international employees. From coordinating inductions to supporting ongoing training needs, your efforts will ensure compliance with mandatory corporate and legal requirements while contributing to employee success and satisfaction.

Job Overview

Employment Type: Full-Time

Shift: Day Shift (Mon - Fri, 9AM - 6PM); Weekends Off

Salary: Up to PHP30,000

Work Setup: Onsite, BGC, Taguig

Exciting Perks Await!

  • Day 1 HMO coverage with a free dependent

  • Prime BGC, Taguig office location with easy access to MRT, restaurants, and banks

  • Day shift schedule

  • Fixed weekends off

  • Unlimited upskilling through Emapta Academy courses (Want to know more? Visit https://bit.ly/EmaptaTrainingCalendar)

  • 24/7 free access to our office gyms (Ortigas and Makati) with a free physical fitness trainer!

  • Exclusive Emapta Lifestyle perks (hotel and restaurant discounts, and more!)

  • Unlimited opportunities for employee referral incentives across the organization

  • Standard government and Emapta benefits

  • Total of 20 annual leaves (including 5 credits convertible to cash)

  • Fun engagement activities for employees

  • Mentorship and exposure to global leaders and teams

  • Career growth opportunities

  • Diverse and supportive work environment

The Qualifications We Seek

  • Bachelor's degree

  • Resides within 1.5 hours commute to BGC

  • 1‚Äì2 years of experience in training administration, ideally in BPO, shared services, or similar fast-paced environments.

  • Experience supporting foreign clients is preferred but not required

  • Expertise in building collaborative relationships with managers, stakeholders, and external suppliers.

  • Proficiency in managing multiple tasks within deadlines.

  • Familiar with Learning Management Systems (LMS) and training process workflows.

  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Word

  • Exceptional attention to detail, with a focus on process improvements.

  • Consistent employment track record, showing reliability, professionalism, and long-term commitment.

Your Daily Tasks

  • Arranging and administering InHealth Inductions, Probationary, and Professional Competency training courses and maintaining records for local and internationally recruited employees.

  • Supporting the administrative delivery of training and assistance for InHealth Scholars studying through international partner universities and hospitals.

  • Ensuring adequate training provision is available to maintain compliance with corporate and statutory legal requirements.

  • Creating, uploading, and maintaining accurate training progress records for both local and international new starters.

  • Communicating training session details and requirements clearly and frequently to relevant stakeholders.

  • Liaising with UK-based managers, providers, and partners via email and telephone to arrange courses and maintain strong relationships.

  • Ensuring delegates receive joining instructions, invites, and webinar links ahead of scheduled training or course dates.

  • Managing feedback from delegates and scholars, highlighting areas for improvement and recognizing positive feedback for management.

  • Monitoring internship progress reports and other requirements for InHealth Scholars.

  • Adding all arranged training to new starter profiles and ensuring timely completion within set deadlines.

  • Reviewing attendance records and updating training completion status promptly.

  • Assisting employees and managers with course bookings, including adding or removing individuals and groups as needed.

  • Updating individual learner records with evidence of previous course attendance.

  • Addressing technical issues affecting users and resolving them promptly.

  • Maintaining accurate and up-to-date data for all training records.

  • Creating weekly and monthly reports on training activities and progress.

  • Compiling HR report data related to learning and development, ensuring accuracy and consistency.

  • Reviewing and maintaining digital learning platforms, including generic and mandatory training courses such as iLearn and MS Office Suite.

Welcome to Emapta Philippines!

Join a team that values camaraderie, excellence, and growth. Recognized as one of the Top 20 Dream Companies of Filipinos in 2024, Emapta stands proudly alongside industry giants, offering stability and exciting career opportunities. Your career flourishes here with competitive compensation, international clients, and a work culture focused on collaboration and innovation. Work with global clients across industries, supported by a stable foundation and like-minded professionals passionate about making an impact. We empower your success with opportunities for personal and professional development in an inclusive environment. Apply now and be part of the #EmaptaEra!

title: VR Training Manager
job_desc:
Are you ready to be part of a dynamic team driving innovation in training and internships? At Ediphi, we're not just envisioning the future; we're actively creating it. As we expand our horizons and take on new challenges, we're looking for talented individuals who share our passion for providing students with leading-edge career training and international and virtual internships. If you're seeking a rewarding career where your ideas and contributions can make a real impact, Ediphi is the place for you!

 

Job Summary: 

The VR Training Manager is responsible for overseeing the development, implementation, and management of virtual reality (VR) training programs. This role ensures the seamless integration of VR technology into training and education initiatives, coordinating with instructional designers, trainers, and technical teams to deliver immersive learning experiences. The manager will also manage program logistics, evaluate effectiveness, and optimize VR content for engagement and skill-building. Additionally, they will provide technical support, train staff on VR systems, and stay updated on emerging VR trends to enhance program offerings.

 

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Oversee the planning and execution of VR training programs. 
  • Collaborate with educators, developers, and stakeholders to create immersive learning experiences. 
  • Manage VR hardware, software, and troubleshooting needs. 
  • Train instructors and users on VR platforms and best practices. 
  • Evaluate program effectiveness and recommend improvements. 
  • Stay current with industry trends and advancements in VR technology.

Qualifications: 

Education: 

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Education, Instructional Design, Computer Science, Information Technology, Multimedia Arts, Hospitality, Education or any related field 

Experience: 

  • At least 3-5 years of experience in VR program development, instructional design, or technology-based training.
  • Experience managing VR hardware and software in an educational, corporate, or training environment. 
  • Background in e-learning, simulation training, or immersive technologies is highly preferred. 
  • Experience in project management and team leadership.

Skills and Competencies: 

  • Strong understanding of VR/AR technologies and their applications in training and education. 
  • Proficiency in VR platforms, software (e.g., Unity, Unreal Engine, VR training simulations), and hardware (VR headsets, motion tracking, etc.). 
  • Excellent communication and training skills to support users with varying levels of tech proficiency. 
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills for troubleshooting VR systems and improving program effectiveness. 
  • Project management skills, including the ability to coordinate multiple teams and deadlines. 
  • Creativity and innovation in designing engaging and effective VR learning experiences. 
  • Ability to stay updated with emerging VR trends and integrate them into training programs

Compensation Package and Benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Government benefits
  • HMO and life insurance upon regularization
  • Company scholarship for children or siblings upon regularization

title: Junior Building-Facade Estimator
job_desc:
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Junior Facade Estimator to join our team. In this role, you will assist in preparing cost estimates for various building-facade projects in the US, with a focus on projects located in New York. This role will require you to collaborate with US based estimators and bid managers to gather essential project information in order to cost a given project as accurately as possible.

This position offers an excellent opportunity for professional growth and will expose you to the highly specialized world of building facades. These projects in New York are subject to some of the most stringent building standards in the world - experience here is highly valued and sought after in the international construction community.

 

Working Hours

As this is a US based company, and collaboration with US based teams is necessary - candidates must be willing to work from 5:00 pm-1:00 am (PH time), 40 hours a week.

 

Working Hours

This is a fully remote position - an office space will be available (located in Makati) for those who would like to work in an office environment and for when in-person meetings are necessary.

 

Key Responsibilities:

Analyze project drawings, specifications, and other documents to understand project requirements.

Prepare accurate and detailed quantity take-offs of various building facade scope items

Assist in preparing detailed cost estimates for facade projects, including materials, labor, and equipment.

Maintain an up-to-date database of costs and suppliers.

Prepare and present cost reports and summaries to senior management.

Collaborate with team members to develop efficient and cost-effective solutions for projects.

 

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field.

Strong analytical and mathematical skills.

Attention the detail is must.

Proficiency reading and understanding Architectural and Engineering Drawings

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word)

Excellent communication skills - must be able to speak English proficiently.

Ability to work well in a team and under tight deadlines.

 

Preferential Qualifications:

Previous experience working in the Building Facade or Glass industry is a plus

Proficiency with Bluebeam by Revu

 

Additional Qualifications:

Previous experience or internships in construction estimating or a related field is preferred is a plus.

Previous experience working on construction projects based in the US is a plus

Proficiency with Autocad is a plus

Experience with Revit is a plus

3d Modelling experience using Sketchup, Rhino, or Revit is a plus
